page.title: 13WOOLAVINGTON GRANGE
page.content: In the 12th Century a second Manor was granted to the{de Woolavington family.It was known as the Manor of Woolavington. When John Morse owned the house in the late{18th Century}it was called the Morses.It was not until 1909 that the owner Major Browning named it the Grange.The grange was split in the 1950's into dwellings. The grange was sold in 1980 and has been further{developed}since this date.Six new dwellings are to occupy the surrounding grounds.The Arches Barn is a newly converted dwelling. Pear tree cottage (once a garden barn) was converted by Mr and Mrs Morgan in 1982,east grange was occupied by Mr Sweet and has some{original windows, oak beams and minstrels gallery which is concealed in the loft.Mr and Mrs Whicksteed now own the Grange.
